title: Steve Irwin's niece Rebecca Lobie becomes an Instagram influencer
text:
Steve Irwin's 'hot niece' Rebecca Lobie made headlines across the world in September after fans discovered her very racy Instagram account.

And just weeks later, the 32-year-old restaurant manager from the Sunshine Coast appears to be leaning towards a career as a social media influencer.

On Monday, the busty blonde promoted two different bikini brands after gaining 13,000 new Instagram followers in the past fortnight alone.

A star is born! Steve Irwin's niece Rebecca Lobie (pictured) appears to have embarked on a career as a social media influencer after her racy Instagram selfies went viral in September

The bikinis were supposedly a present from Rebecca's husband Mick, whom she shares two young children with, ahead of an upcoming family holiday.

However, she tagged each company while modelling their designs, which strongly suggests her posts were paid-for advertisements.

According to Influencer Marketing Hub, Rebecca could make up to $160 per sponsored post based on her current statistics.

Selfie ready! On Monday, the busty blonde promoted two different bikini brands after gaining 13,000 new Instagram followers in the past two weeks alone

Fashion icon! The bikinis were supposedly a present from Rebecca's husband Mick (right), whom she shares two young children with, ahead of an upcoming family holiday

According to her LinkedIn account, Rebecca left her job as managing director of Australia Zoo in December 2015.

During her tenure, she oversaw 'multiple food outlets' at the Sunshine Coast tourist attraction, as well as 'catering and functions'.

In 2016, the Courier Mail reported that Rebecca, who is now working as a restaurant manager near her home in Mooloolaba, had cut all ties with Australia Zoo.

Side hustle? According to Influencer Marketing Hub, Rebecca could make up to $160 per sponsored post based on her current statistics

Cutting ties with the family business: According to her LinkedIn account, Rebecca left her job as managing director of Australia Zoo in December 2015

Four years ago, Rebecca shared a close bond with her 21-year-old cousin Bindi when they were both colleagues at Australia Zoo.

However, they no longer follow each other on Instagram and Bindi hasn't interacted with her older relative's profile since 2015.

It's possible that Bindi, who is known for wearing conservative outfits, disapproves of Rebecca's raunchy social media photos.
